Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (16 ll.) and verso (names of 16 witnesses). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Farming lease between the ippeus Heracleitos(?) son of Lycophron (lessee) and the lector of the necropolis of Siut Tef-Hap son of Petetumis (lessor) in respect of arable land on the temple-endowment of Upuat. Date year 11 Thoth 29 of Ptolemy Philometor = BC 171 Nov. 2". Nos. 10575-10601 from the Siut Archive.
Curator's comments: Bibliography Martin C.J., Ptolemaic Demotic land leases, in J.G. Keenan, J.G. Manning, U. Yiftach-Firanko (eds.), Law and Legal Practice in Egypt from Alexander to the Arab Conquest. A selection of Papyrological Sources in Translation, with Introductions and Commentary. Cambridge, 2014, p. 358-361. Felber, H., Demotische Ackerpachtverträge (ÄA 58). Wiesbaden, 1997, p. 61-5, 83, 103, 111, 154, 193-4, 219. Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Felber 1997 / Demotische Ackerpachtverträge der Ptolemäerzeit : Untersuchungen zu Aufbau, Entwicklung und inhaltlichen Aspekten einer Gruppe von demotischen Urkunden (p.61-4)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2743) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2743)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss, delaminating Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Supported overall: white paper Displayed in Room 63 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
Acquisition notes: Purchased from M. Nahman. Cf. the additional sheets at the end of Thompson's MS Catalogue, titled "B.M. Nahman Papyri (1923)".
